intro: Galium hanryi, commonly known as the Hanryi bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, particularly China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers in summer, which are followed by small, spherical berries. Galium hanryi is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. It is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
